revised_title: Botany of the Southern Cold Temperate Zone: A Discussion on Plant Life and Climate
tldr: The author discusses the differences in plant life and vegetation found in the southern cold temperate zone, comparing it to the northern cold temperate zone. They explore the impact of climate, specifically oceanic influences, on the growth of evergreen broadleaved forests in the region. The author also examines the distribution of deciduous and evergreen forests, and the factors that influence their differentiation.
